Content:
ever since that fateful first night when i crossed back through the door
that led me to another world i made absolutely sure that
it was sealed shut to stop the intruder on the other side,
that psycho cosplayer with a knife could never disturb my peace again.
she slashed me across the hand. the drunken thief broke in,
and little does that bitch know and little does that bastard know
that my cousin has a fucking law degree: i’m a well-trained royal guard and
she won’t be laughing when she thinks she’ll have the upper hand in any fight, and
win. all she probably does is stream all day as a woman that wears knights’ armor,
making e-girl money from her fans’ donations. he thinks he can beat me, but i destroyed him.
maybe i should report her bitch-ass to the irs. there’s not a chance they do anything helpful.
her yellow color contacts and realistic sword? wearing nobleman’s clothes? i admit that
she surely has the body for it. i know the type: they’re attractive, but pathetic weaklings,
ones like them train abs every day at the gym, and are not my type at all. the rich always
are dependent on daddy and mommy’s money, going into their father’s exorbitant savings,
wasting it all on new cars and houses, buying wares to advance their family image.
though she’s shallower than a kiddie pool. that bastard hasn’t fought a day in his life.
i’m an engineer at a prestigious aerospace firm. i’ll remind you that i graduated top of my class
so i design the future while she’s in cadet school, a chosen guardian that’s
trying to decide what livestream to do next, undergoing a test for a permanent spot and
freed from any societal responsibility, eager to please my mentors. I grew up with
such incredible violence inflicted on me. And nothing in the village across the lake. Because
I’ve fought the dull ache of depression since I’ve always fought the painful sting of anxiety,
my brother died in battle right before i started college, after my father and siblings burned in the siege of hillfar.
and it’s rough trying to find reasons to continue on. i learned you can only rebuild when there is nothing left.
that girl reminds me of my brother in a way. but that civillian reminds me of my craftsman father.
it’s because of her everflowing energy. she lives in a world stained by conflict, there are few that build
with such passion, wasting her life in a warrior’s role: an inner space for peace and humor, which is stupid and
whether it’s real or just costume play, it is incredibly foolish, because fear is more useful.
the real world is slow and boring in the modern age, but in my world the sounds of war echo through the night.
i truly wouldn’t have it any other way. even if i question whether i can live past the terrible things i’ve seen is
the value of my life and often i wonder if it is worth it. something that i struggle with, knowing that
time passes and i find that i have no prospect of love. my friends outside the guard have husbands but
i’m just a lonely guy with a new empty house, and i’m just a hardy tomboy with no feminine charms, and
i’m still waiting on a promotion that will never come and besides my distant boyfriend, i’ll never find anyone. so
pissing away time in the office as it sucks life from me is all i have left to do, i think, is just give my life in battle.
all i might do until i die from old age. i will be alone and abandoned on the battlefield.
i wish i could find someone to prove me wrong. i really wish someone would change things up. someone
with radiant energy like my roomates in college, calm and collected and peaceful when everyone is afraid.
but not that crazy girl on the other side of the wall, and surely not the wimpy nerd that lives next to me. he’s
kind of hot but in a crazy psycho way. only got looks and brains but no spine.
maybe i can find that sense of passion again if one day i’ll find that sense of peace again. i think
i keep dragging myself into work everyday, until i need to wear down the anguish and cowardice by
obtaining the faintest shred of recognition. burying my fears of death:
the fear of death is only a professional one. my fear of death is only a physical one
but it pales in comparison to how my brother died, and is nothing compared to how my father died,
freezing with bullet holes in his stomach. entombed in ashes beneath the old cabin.
like his death my world is that of ice, and like his passing i live inside the burning fire,
so apathetic to everything i struggle to stay warm. so afraid of everything that i struggle to cool down.
god knows i’m on the edge of losing my dream job, and gods know i’m on the verge of being cast into war,
without the passion i could swear i once had, stricken by these pathetic reflexes of fear,
unable to ask out a high-school crush i work with. even struggling to connect with the distant man i love.
and it surely won’t happen if i cant stabilize my stupid
feelings as i collapse in weakness to the floor, feeling the
blood drain from my extremities as i nearly punch a hole
in the stupid door.
as i sit on the couch for two hours scrolling through
titles on netflix, unable to find anything that even
remotely excites me as i doomscroll on my phone,
i pound relentlessly on the wooden door.
that girl pounds restlessly on the wooden door.
it seems like he might actually not care about me at all.
it seems like she might actually be in trouble.
maybe it was a bad idea to bolt the door shut so she maybe it was a bad idea to throw all those kitchen knives
couldn’t ambush me at night, when i was in my chonies at his head, or to pull my sword and slice that serious
pining for a midnight snack after a long day of nothing. gash in his hand before asking who he was.
but i feel the strangest pull that draws me to her. but i feel the strangest pull that draws me to him.
a sense of vitality and excitement i long for, with an a sense of stillness and comfort, with a brave sense of
energy for life that realizes how special it is. humor that’s stronger than all i have to fear.
like someone from my past i struggle to forget. like someone from my past that i miss so much.
and with those looks and a killer body that’s kept me up and with those muscular arms and handsome scruff of
all those nights i struggle to forget her. stubble that’s kept him fresh in my mind.
so i rush to the grage to find the power drill, so i begin to ignite the essenced fire magic in my hands,
glad there isn’t a security deposit to worry about pleading as the tears crest my eyes, longing for someone
when i own the damn place. to comfort me in a way i’ve never felt.
and when the door opens, and when the door opens,
i see Katiya in an entirely different light. i see Cody in an entirely different light.
